channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023100707
item.description:
Report X-2023100707

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A RATTLING AEROSOL SOUND COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 2.6 OUNCE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CAN OF ALUSHIELD AEROSOL BANDAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE CONTACT NAME ON THE THERMAL LABEL IS BRITTANY DILLBACK.

item.title: Report E-2023110116
item.description:
Report E-2023110116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1219 was crushed in a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remediate the isopropyl acetate from the impacted drum. Crews then plugged the punctured 55-gallon drum and containerized it in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for transport back to the R+L Edinburgh, Indiana Terminal.

item.title: Report X-2023100754
item.description:
Report X-2023100754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sept 29th a small drum containing UN1133 Adhesives, 3, PGIII was damaged by a forklift while moving the pallet that contained the shipment causing the liquid adhesive to leak out. The damaged drum was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

Report X-2023100018

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023100018-LOADER DISCOVERED LEAKING PACKAGE AND REPORTED IT TO THEIR SUPERVISOR AND THEN THE SUPERVISOR REPORTED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE RESPONDERS, THE RESPONDERS CLEANED UP THE AREA OF THE SPILLAND THEN TOOK THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE CAGE FOR FUTHER PROCESSING X-2023100019- PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED LEAKING PACKAGE, NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO ALERTED RESPONDERS THAT CLEANED UP SPILL AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023100007
item.description:
Report X-2023100007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/09/2023 at approximatley 1040, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 291445 at the hub facility in Indianapolis , reporting a flammable liqud spill, The shipment consisted of 4 plastic drums packaged in one fiberboard box. One of the plastic bottles leaked due to a loose closure, resulting in spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and the shipment awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023090755
item.description:
Report X-2023090755

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release at the INDH facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained one glass bottle packaged with Styrofoam peanuts. The plastic cap on the bottle was sheered off causing a release. The package was placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.
